result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Charles Traficante was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence. STRAIGHT TIME.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA) during the period of probation. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
No contact with victim Charles S. or UWM campus or satellite.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
Successfully complete Anger Management.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve 100 days (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of
 18 months:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
 
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Successfully complete Anger Management.
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with victim Charles S. or UWM campus or satellite.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA) 
          during the period of probation.
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due 
          immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
        

 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights; received and filed.

Defendant Joseph Charles Traficante in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Joseph Charles Traficante in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. Status conference held off record.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph Charles Traficante in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference. For reasons stated on the record,   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for 03-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph Charles Traficante
Current: 3330 West Kilbourn Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 02-05-2015)
Prior: 3330 West Kilbourn Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Charles S. or his residence or place of employment

Defendant Joseph Charles Traficante in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Status Conference in Branch 37.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/5/15 @ 1:30pm
